review_title: It was an overall good experience and I'm glad I did it!
job_title: Direct Support Provider in Marshall, MN
pros: Great entry level job I'd you're thinking about going into social work,sociology, or psychology
cons: Can clients can be tough if you aren't used to helping stubborn people

pros: Good pay, free parking, flexible schedules
Good co workers and team work
cons: It has its good and bad moments

job_title: Patient Ambassador/Care Coordinator in Monroe, LA
pros: Enjoyed interacting with patients and nursing staff
cons: Was Hired for one job ended up working a completely different job. Apparently they needed kitchen staff. Autumn too close on personal level to employees.

review_title: Great if you like to overwork
pros: Great residents, labor union and benefits
cons: Lots of gossip. Lots of call ins. Admins will not help if you are short so you are overworked. They push you to do Jobs that are not in your job description let alone you are not licensed for. Heard many residents being yelled at or mistreated. Told to go in their briefs because the nurse wants a cig break. Screaming at demetia patients who don't know where there family is or where they are. The place is very unorganized. Meal pass is a disaster.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) in Farmington, MN
pros: Small town feel in the suburbs. Community is very supportive of the Care Center
cons: There is a lot of employee turnover

review_title: MI Consumer Counselor at Prairie Community Services
job_title: Consumer Counselor in Fergus Falls, MN
pros: I really enjoyed working with the consumers in the group home. My co-workers were great too for the most part. The job was pretty easy to do, and fun too if you enjoy helping people.
cons: Inconsistency. When our program coordinator of 10+ years found another job and quit, we were without one for months. The different house managers would rotate in to help run our house. Then they hired a young girl fresh out of college, to do the job. She would have been great if she really wanted the job. However, she viewed the job as a "stepping stone" to a career in the social work field rather than a career in itself. She resigned within 6 months when she found a job "in her field" and after she had run our house into the ground. The company ended up closing our house and all the staff had to choose whether to quit or stay on with the company, by transferring to another home. If you chose to transfer, you could bump someone out of their position at another home, depending on your seniority. Most of us decided to just leave rather than push someone out of their job.

review_title: Love the residence,  but PCS is very low paying
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Alexandria, MN
pros: Lots of homes to work at, always hours to pick up.
cons:
1) Expensive health insurance with high deductibles and still minimal coverage. 
2) They don't tell you upon being hired that they do not give pay increases. They say to write to our Congressmen to request more money for the individuals we serve then they can give us a pay raise. That is actually a load of crap because they are a privately owned company and can make their own choices. It is very sad that there is so much employee turnover because the residents deserve better. We have lost so many great care providers due to the company not giving any pay creases. Not even a cost of living raise. I have worked there between five-and-ten years and have yet to see an increase for anyone. They should at least be honest and tell you when you interview that the mere $11 an hour you will make is all you will ever make thrre unless the government does something. What a cop out. I only stay because I love the people I serve. But let's face it McDonald's pays a heck of a lot more.

review_title: Great area to learn new skills, but not a forever job.
pros: The company encourages one to continue education and allows one to be able to move up in the company. The facility is patient centered and strive to provide excellent patient care.
cons: Shortage of staff is a constant occurrence requiring staff to work extra and new staff to have limiting training. Mandating is something that is required.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Morris, MN
pros: Good pay and good availability of hours.
cons: Expect CNAs to handle extremely difficult/overwhelming workload.

job_title: Mental Health Practitioner in Duluth, MN
cons: Very stressful.low pay compared with other  MHPs in Area..Horrible health care benefits. High employee turnover.

pros: It has mostly good people as staff and nurses.
cons: Negative environment, poor management, disorganized, religious, failure to train staff very well, odd expectations, mandates people regularly, gave me a crappy mug that had metal shavings in it.  Not a friendly or constructive place.
